tool.name: metfragcli
tool.description: Run a single MetFrag query given a MS/MS peak list and the precursor m/z or molecular formula.
tool.command: java -jar /usr/local/bin/MetFragCLI.jar PeakListPath=$infile MetFragDatabaseType=$MetFragDatabaseType IonizedPrecursorMass=$IonizedPrecursorMass DatabaseSearchRelativeMassDeviation=$DatabaseSearchRelativeMassDeviation FragmentPeakMatchAbsoluteMassDeviation=$FragmentPeakMatchAbsoluteMassDeviation FragmentPeakMatchRelativeMassDeviation=$FragmentPeakMatchRelativeMassDeviation PrecursorIonMode=$PrecursorIonMode IsPositiveIonMode=$IsPositiveIonMode MetFragCandidateWriter=CSV SampleName=Galaxy ResultsFile=$outfile MaximumTreeDepth=$MaximumTreeDepth MetFragPreProcessingCandidateFilter=UnconnectedCompoundFilter #if $additional_metfrag_scores != "None": MetFragScoreTypes=FragmenterScore,$additional_metfrag_scores MetFragScoreWeights=1.0,`echo $additional_metfrag_scores | sed "s/[a-zA-Z0-9]\+/1.0/g"` #else: MetFragScoreTypes=FragmenterScore MetFragScoreWeights=1.0 #end if

param.name: infile
param.label: Input file with peak list in tsv/txt format

param.name: MetFragDatabaseType
param.label: Database
param.help: Database to which queries are sent. At the moment, only PubChem is supported.

param.name: DatabaseSearchRelativeMassDeviation
param.label: Relative mass deviation for database search
param.help: Relative mass deviation used for database search.

param.name: FragmentPeakMatchAbsoluteMassDeviation
param.label: Fragment peak match absolute mass deviation
param.help: Absolute mass deviation for fragment peaks to be matched.

param.name: FragmentPeakMatchRelativeMassDeviation
param.label: Fragment peak match relative mass deviation
param.help: Relative mass deviation for fragment peaks to be matched.

param.name: IsPositiveIonMode
param.label: Ion Mode
param.help: Ion mode that was used (either positive or negative).

tool.help: MetFrag: In silico fragmentation for computer assisted identification of metabolite mass spectra.
